arm_group.description: medical students took part in workshop
general population took part in workshop
all students from different subjects, non medical and paramedical

brief_summary.textblock:
This  prospective  study evaluate teaching efficacy of CPR training using different methods
      in general population, medical students and non medical students with the 12 months
      evaluation of its recall

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of CPR Teaching in Mass Training

detailed_description.textblock:
In a prospective and observational study of 2000 individuals in three different groups
      including medical students, non-medical students and general populations four different
      protocols of CPR training were applied and their efficacy were compared between the groups.
      Meanwhile, 12 months after the study course, 460 participants from three groups were asked
      to take part in a theoretical and practical exam to evaluate the long term efficacy of the
      four protocols.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all participant take part in workshop

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  refuse to take part in exams

intervention.description: workshop to teach CPR with lecture and human models
intervention.intervention_name: Workshop using Lecture and human model

intervention.description: workshops using film review about CPR
using educational films and human model and lecture for training
intervention.intervention_name: Workshop using Lecture, human model as well as Educational  Film

intervention.description: training volunteers with lecture, films, and human models and giving them reference book for referral
intervention.intervention_name: Workshop using Lecture, human model, Educational Film as well as reference book

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Teaching Methods in Mass CPR Training in Different Groups of the Society

primary_outcome.description: pre test and post test exam before and after workshop
practical exam about general measures of CPR

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: questionaire showing their satisfaction about the workshop

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator)
